page.title: 07HOME LIFE
page.content: iron, home computer and a freezer. A few people owned a microwave, a video recorder and a dishwasher. None questioned owned a coffee maker. All these appliances were in frequent use with the washing machine being used most. When we questioned people about the animals they kept as pets dogs were the most popular, cats were next followed by rabbits, hamsters then gerbils. One lady kept a canary for company. Most people, when they went on holiday had someone to look after their pets and two people had entered their pets in shows, one of them having won prize money. We interviewed about food. We found that eating habits had changed over the last five years with people eating less sugar, fat and salt and eating more fibre.
